^ no lol

1. I got full audio from the very first frame. If you haven't I suggest switching codecs or even media player.

2. The sound was a wee bit out of sync and it seems to be done deliberately. Fortunately there's an easy fix in Media Player Classic: from the meny select Play > Audio > Options > Audio switcher. You might find that the sync is preset 150 ms off. Set it to 0 and you should be fine.

If the sound is in sync, you probably haven't enabled Audio Time Shift at all, and then you don't have to worry about #2 above. :)

All in all, excellent quality. Many thanks to froggie100 for sharing!
